ANNEXURE A2_ CERTIFIED COPY OF FINAL REPORT IN CRIME NO. 357/2014 OF BEDAKAM POLICE STATION. ANNEXURE A3_ AFFIDAVIT DATED 16.11.2017 SWORN BY THE 2ND RESPONDENT. RESPONDENT(S)' ANNEXURES: NIL ITRUE COPY! P.A.TO JUDGE sts Plt) 2017/KER/49569 B. KEMAL PASHA, J. Dated this the 7 day of December, 2017 ORDER Petitioners are accused in Crime No.357 of 2014 of Bedakam Police Station, which is now pending as C.C.No.3705 of 2014 of the Judicial First Class Magistrate's Court-I, Kasaragod, for the offences punishable under Sections 323, 324 and 506 (ii) read with Section 34 of the Indian Penal Code. 2. It seems that the matter has been amicably settled between the parties. 3. On going through the facts and circumstances of the case, it seems that the matter can be permitted to be settled. No criminal antecedents have been reported against the petitioners. The second respondent has filed separate affidavits as Annexure A3, affirming that the matter has been amicably settled between him and the petitioners and he has_ no complaint against the petitioners. Considering the fact that Ei aael atee| Bae 2017/KER/49569 Cri.M.C. No.8168 of 2017 -2- the matter has already been settled amicably between the parties, this court is satisfied that no purpose would be served in proceeding with the trial of the case. Matters being so, all further proceedings in C.C.No.3705 of 2014 of the Judicial First Class Magistrate's Court-I, Kasaragod, in Crime No.357 of 2014 of the Bedakam Police Station, are liable to be quashed. In the result, this Crl.M.C. is allowed and all further proceedings in C.C.No.3705 of 2014 of the Judicial First Class Magistrate's Court-I, Kasaragod, in Crime No.357 of 2014 of the Bedakam Police Station, are hereby quashed. Sd/- B.KEMAL PASHA JUDGE Scl/07.12.2017
